desc:
A class for performing gestures in tests.

The simplest way to create a TestGesture is to call WidgetTester.startGesture.
name: flutter_test.TestGesture

methods.desc:
Create a TestGesture without dispatching any events from it. The TestGesture can then be manipulated to perform future actions.

By default, the pointer identifier used is 1. This can be overridden by providing the pointer argument.

A function to use for hit testing must be provided via the hitTester argument, and a function to use for dispatching events must be provided via the dispatcher argument.

The device kind defaults to PointerDeviceKind.touch, but move events when the pointer is "up" require a kind other than PointerDeviceKind.touch, like PointerDeviceKind.mouse, for example, because touch devices can't produce movement events when they are "up".

None of the arguments may be null. The dispatcher and hitTester arguments are required.
methods.example:
Implementation

TestGesture({
  @required EventDispatcher dispatcher,
  @required HitTester hitTester,
  int pointer = 1,
  PointerDeviceKind kind = PointerDeviceKind.touch,
}) : assert(dispatcher != null),
     assert(hitTester != null),
     assert(pointer != null),
     assert(kind != null),
     _dispatcher = dispatcher,
     _hitTester = hitTester,
     _pointer = TestPointer(pointer, kind),
     _result = null;
methods.name: TestGesture

methods.desc: End the gesture by canceling the pointer (as would happen if the system showed a modal dialog on top of the Flutter application, for instance).
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> cancel() {
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() async {
    assert(_pointer._isDown);
    await _dispatcher(_pointer.cancel(), _result);
    assert(!_pointer._isDown);
    _result = null;
  });
}
methods.name: cancel

methods.desc: Dispatch a pointer down event at the given downLocation, caching the hit test result.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> down(Offset downLocation) async {
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() async {
    _result = _hitTester(downLocation);
    return _dispatcher(_pointer.down(downLocation), _result);
  });
}
methods.name: down

methods.desc: Dispatch a pointer down event at the given downLocation, caching the hit test result with a custom down event.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> downWithCustomEvent(Offset downLocation, PointerDownEvent event) async {
  _pointer.setDownInfo(event, downLocation);
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() async {
    _result = _hitTester(downLocation);
    return _dispatcher(event, _result);
  });
}
methods.name: downWithCustomEvent

methods.desc:
Send a move event moving the pointer by the given offset.

If the pointer is down, then a move event is dispatched. If the pointer is up, then a hover event is dispatched. Touch devices are not able to send hover events.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> moveBy(Offset offset, {Duration timeStamp = Duration.zero}) {
  return moveTo(_pointer.location + offset, timeStamp: timeStamp);
}
methods.name: moveBy

methods.desc:
Send a move event moving the pointer to the given location.

If the pointer is down, then a move event is dispatched. If the pointer is up, then a hover event is dispatched. Touch devices are not able to send hover events.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> moveTo(Offset location, {Duration timeStamp = Duration.zero}) {
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() {
    if (_pointer._isDown) {
      assert(_result != null,
          'Move events with the pointer down must be preceeded by a down '
          'event that captures a hit test result.');
      return _dispatcher(_pointer.move(location, timeStamp: timeStamp), _result);
    } else {
      assert(_pointer.kind != PointerDeviceKind.touch,
          'Touch device move events can only be sent if the pointer is down.');
      return _dispatcher(_pointer.hover(location, timeStamp: timeStamp), null);
    }
  });
}
methods.name: moveTo

methods.desc: End the gesture by releasing the pointer.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> up() {
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() async {
    assert(_pointer._isDown);
    await _dispatcher(_pointer.up(), _result);
    assert(!_pointer._isDown);
    _result = null;
  });
}
methods.name: up

methods.desc: In a test, send a move event that moves the pointer by the given offset.
methods.example:
Implementation

@visibleForTesting
Future<void> updateWithCustomEvent(PointerEvent event, { Duration timeStamp = Duration.zero }) {
  _pointer.setDownInfo(event, event.position);
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard<void>(() {
    return _dispatcher(event, _result);
  });
}
methods.name: updateWithCustomEvent
